title.justification: The title is at the top of the paper.
title.quote: A N E XPRESSIVE R EPRESENTATION OF G ENERAL 3D S HAPES

extractions.description: This paper introduces Ghost-on-the-Shell (G-SHELL), a new 3D mesh representation that can effectively parameterize both watertight and non-watertight meshes of varying topologies. The representation is grid-based, differentiable, and supports applications like multiview image reconstruction and generative modeling. The authors demonstrate that G-SHELL achieves state-of-the-art performance in non-watertight mesh reconstruction and generation tasks.

type.justification: The paper presents empirical results demonstrating the effectiveness of G-SHELL in various tasks such as reconstruction and generative modeling of non-watertight meshes.
type.quote: We empirically demonstrate that G-S HELL achieves state-of-the-art performance on non-watertight mesh reconstruction and generation tasks, while also performing effectively for watertight meshes.

name.justification: The paper primarily deals with 3D shape representation, reconstruction, and generation, which are key areas of research within Computer Vision.
name.quote: The creation of photorealistic virtual worlds requires the accurate modeling of 3D surface geometry for a wide range of objects.

name.justification: One of the key applications of the proposed G-SHELL representation is the reconstruction of 3D meshes from multiview images.
name.quote: applications: differentiable rasterization-based reconstruction from multiview images

name.justification: The G-SHELL representation is also used for generative modeling of 3D meshes.
name.quote: and generative modeling of non-watertight meshes

name.justification: The primary model introduced in the paper is called Ghost-on-the-Shell (G-SHELL).
name.quote: Our new representation, called Ghost-on-the-Shell (G-S HELL), enables two important applications: differentiable rasterization-based reconstruction from multiview images and generative modelling of non-watertight meshes.

is_contributed.justification: The model G-SHELL is introduced and developed by the authors within the scope of this paper.

is_compared.justification: The G-SHELL model is numerically compared to other models like NeuralUDF, NeUDF, and NeAT.
is_compared.quote: We compare our method to current state-of-the-art methods for non-watertight mesh reconstruction: NeuralUDF [38], NeUDF [35] and NeAT [40].
